Crimes.Violation_Type: Use of expired work permit upon re-entry
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of exclusion order under subsection 44(2) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, subsection 44(2), paragraph 20(1)(a)
Crimes.Application_Facts: Barua re-entered Canada with an expired work permit and admitted intent to stay permanently
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Foreign national seeking temporary residence with potential permanent intent
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Dishonesty during questioning, lack of demonstrated intent to leave Canada
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Contravention of immigration provisions, lack of valid work authorization
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Dual intent under section 22 of the Act
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Judicial review of Border Services Officers' decision
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: BSOs found Barua lacked credibility due to dishonesty
Crimes.Evidence_Used: BSO notes, admission of permanent intent, expired work permit
Crimes.Application_Basis: Invalid work permit and misrepresentation of intent
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Admission of intent to remain permanently, status at time of entry
Crimes.Governing_Rule: A foreign national may be excluded if they contravene the Act
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to demonstrate genuine temporary intent
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Potential non-compliance with immigration laws and removal orders
Crimes.Cause_Description: Misrepresentation of intentions and use of invalid work permit
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: BSO notes relied upon as primary evidence
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Failed to meet conditions for temporary residence
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Authority of BSOs at port of entry
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Admissions and documentation reviewed for compliance
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Exclusion was reasonable based on facts and law
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of supporting documentation for dual intent

Crimes.Crime_Name: Misrepresentation under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of exclusion order under section 44(2) of the IRPA
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, section 44(2)
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Barua deemed not credible due to inconsistent statements
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Oral admissions, officer notes, travel documents
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Misrepresentation of intent to remain in Canada
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Lack of demonstrated dual intent and honesty
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to disclose true immigration intent
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: None identified – decision based on available evidence
Crimes.Application_Factor: Intent to stay permanently without proper status
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Misrepresentation regarding intent to remain in Canada
Crimes.Document_Fraud: No document forgery, but misuse of expired permit
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Focus: Canadian immigration law at point of entry
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to disclose permanent residency intent

Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to Comply with Visa Requirements
Crimes.Violation_Type: Entry without valid visa or permit
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of exclusion order under subsection 44(2) of the IRPA
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, paragraph 20(1)(a), subsection 44(2)
Crimes.Application_Facts: Re-entered Canada on expired work permit, expressed intent to reside permanently
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Foreign national without valid temporary resident status
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Admitted intent to stay permanently without proper documentation
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Non-compliance with visa and work permit requirements
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Demonstration of dual intent and compliance with entry conditions
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Doubt cast on intent to comply with temporary residence terms
Crimes.Evidence_Used: BSO notes, applicant’s statements, expired work permit
Crimes.Application_Basis: Lack of valid visa and failure to meet residency requirements
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Statements about permanent intent, validity of work permit
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Foreign nationals must hold valid visas and intend to comply with conditions
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: No proof of valid status or temporary intent
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Risk of non-compliance with immigration obligations
Crimes.Cause_Description: Intent to stay permanently without meeting visa requirements
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Officer notes accepted as reliable record
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Contradictions between claimed intent and actions
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Failed to meet temporary resident obligations
Crimes.Misrepresentation_Element: Implied through concealment of true intent
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Focus on intent and documentary compliance
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Decision was transparent, justifiable, and within acceptable range
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Insufficient evidence to support dual intent
